sentence.Network_en: It's a toss-up whether oil prices will go up or down over the days ahead.
sentence.Network_cn: 油价在今后的日子里会上涨还是下跌都有可能。

sentence.Network_en: "We might toss up for it," suggested Ted. "If it's heads, then we'll talk."
sentence.Network_cn: “我们可以掷硬币来决定。”特德建议道，“如果是正面，我们就谈谈。”

sentence.Network_en: The election was a toss - up, the winner still hasn't been determined.
sentence.Network_cn: 这场选举胜负难分,截至目前还不知鹿死谁手.

entry.tran: (发生几率各半的)相等机会;难以定夺的事
entry.def: If you say that it is a toss-up whether one thing will happen or another thing will happen, you mean that either result seems equally likely.

example.ex: It's a toss-up whether oil prices will go up or down over the days ahead.
example.tran: 油价在今后的日子里会上涨还是下跌都有可能。

sentences.sentence: "it's a toss-up whether he will win or lose"
